the way in which you see the information from a computer program on a screen, or how you type information into the program
the part of a computer system that connects two different machines
the way in which two subjects, events etc affect each other
The book deals with the interface between accountancy and law.
the surface where two things touch each other
if you interface two parts of a computer system, or if they interface, you connect them
if two people or groups interface with each other, they communicate with each other and work together
the point at which two subjects, events etc are connected with each other or have an effect on one another
The next chapter discusses the interface between accountancy and the law.
the way that a particular computer program shows information on the screen to the user
the part of a computer system that connects two different machines or systems
the interface between the computer and the printer
if two people or companies interface, they work together on a particular problem, each one using their own specialist knowledge

to connect a piece of computer equipment or a computer system with another piece of equipment or another system
